The deep layers, due to their aesthetic appearance, should have a more "scary" soundtrack. In any case, the song "excuse" would look good for the nether

The antlers would have a couple uses, each adding a niche but interesting mechanic to the game:
1. A player can wear antlers on his/her head to gain the “sculk sense” effect. This effect is similar to the nausea or blindness effects, it permanently modified the player’s vision until the antlers are removed (either one antler is placed in the helmet slot, or an “antler helmet” type item could be made with just two antlers. Either way works). The sculk sense effect would essentially switch the player’s vision from regular to the vision of a Warden. The player can only see a black screen, other than grayish outlines of unidentifiable blocks for the environment. When the player sees movement, a white blip would eminate from the source of the movement or sound to notify the player of movement. This effect could be really fun for mini games, also the antlers would just look dope as a helmet type item.
2. A player can combine one antler with an arrow to create a “sculk arrow.” When shot at a player, this arrow will add the “sculk sense” effect to any player hit with the arrow. The effect will be applied for 15 seconds, then the duration ends. (Details pt 1, continued in comments)

It was confirmed that Warden's will not attack each other, and you almost certainly won't encounter more than one Warden at the same time. The incentive to go to the Deep Dark will be through the structures and blocks you find there.

Melly Dow, That's because it would have been utterly complex and confusing to a lot of people. It would have certainly had a lot of performance issues. Also if that was the case, then how would the ores change hardness depending on whether they are Deepslate or normal ores?
Uh... Redstone is already quite abundant in the new Caves, you can get tons of it quite quickly

I don't understand how you could need that much redstone out of perhaps the scicraft server, or something, but I agree with the netherquartz ore vein part. It's a building block item, much like copper, so why shouldn't it get a similar treatment?

--I mean aside from the nether being very open-spaced. I suppose nether quartz veins would have to be more abundant, since they'd naturally be smaller than the overworld veins.

idk
How big are we talking?

Who is having such trouble finding redstone that they must farm witches? How much redstone are megaprojects requiring these days? The majority of the playerbase ends up swimming in the stuff, stacks and stacks of redstone blocks they will never use.

A different method of obtaining bulk redstone is in order, a method requiring one to go out of their way to get it, instead of one that's going to be in people's way, filling their inventories with red dust while they are after other things. A method that has larger returns than witches.
Possibly a way to craft redstone from copper and other common ingredients.

Quartz veins are cool tho.
Hotter lava would be yellower, not redder. Black body radiation makes it glow!

No, just no. First, the Deep Dark blocks and features need that extra time in order for the developers to fulfill their design, so they should only be implemented in the holiday. In the Caves & Cliffs FAQ, they didn't mention or even hint that the Sculk features will be in the Summer update, so it's almost certain that they will come in the holiday release. Also how can you have blocks and a mob that is meant to be a part of a dark huge cave just appear randomly when you're exploring in the open air in a totally different dimension? The people who are saying that the End and Sculk are related are just speculating about Minecraft lore, which is something you're meant to do. No direct correlation between the Sculk and the End has been given or confirmed, and by doing what you want them to do they'd just be saying "the Sculk and End are related" despite nobody ever confirming that. It's meant to be a mystrey of the Minecraft lore. I just don't see how any of this could come together. It doesn't add strategy to the End, it makes it inconsistent and makes End Cities frustrating, as you're meant to move around freely within them.
sculk isnt related to the end
Do you suggest this because too many are asking for copper armor and tools?

No, it's an ore. It has minerals in rock
That's literally the definition of ore
youre right
Do you have any ideas for these said-"more uses"?
I understand your needs but if we want to be logic, the natural block cannot be transform to a stair or a slab.

Since it seems that glow squids have been decided to only spawn underground, maybe the full moon could spawn a pink variant of the glow squid in the oceans instead. It would be even better if they dropped something magical, encouraging players to go out on that occasion

Oh it's deep alright, it has way more depth than ever before... just not the kind of depth you meant! XD

Ambient cave noises would be epic!

(Btw, the Nether update only added 3 biomes. The Nether Wastes is just a renamed and barely altered version of the regular Nether biome they had before).

The update is only half through development! You're literally judging the update as a whole and talking about its polish when they have about 3 months or more to finish it! First of all, you not considering the Deep Dark as a biome doesn't really make any sense. It is an extremely unique place with a ton of exclusive blocks, mechanics and gameplay, but it is almost certainly has an environment as well that would make it feel like a biome rather than a structure. I think you mean that it feels so unique and different and has so many specific and mind blowing features that it feels more like a generated structure, but I don't get how that contradicts with it being counted as a biome. They would definitely give it an environment and polish that makes it feel more with the rest of the caves and feel more like you're exploring a biome rather than a structure. Kingbdogz has explicitly said it wouldn't even look remotely the same as we've seen in the video. I would definitely love for the caves to have exclusive music and more ambience, but we don't know whether this would happen or not, and we can't judge the polish of the update since they're not even close to the stage were they are done. This update is so huge, and the things they've done are already revolutionary, so I'm just suggesting that we need to be a little more patient before we could truly judge the update and talk about the more cosmetic features like music and animations of very specific mobs.
Lasercraft 32, the Nether Update added Crimson Forests, Warped Forests, Soul Sand Valleys and Basalt Deltas. That is 4 biomes added.

Do not forget this update isn’t close to being finished. The developers added ambience and music to the nether biomes close to the end of 1.16 development- we are not close to that point for the Caves and Cliffs update.

The glow squid moves like that because it derives from the glow squid. Regular squids act like how the glow squid acts, they are not supposed to reflect the characteristics of an axolotl.

Now we're not even close to the release of the full update. World generation and new height, ore distribution and new biomes have been postponed into a holiday update, while most of the smaller features like Copper, Amethysts, Goats, Glow Squids and Axolotols will come this summer. With that new timeline, the developers will definitely have time to fully enhance, polish and perhaps expand the update. Honestly with the old timeline and the development pace, I could barely imagine them being able to add new sound design, let alone come up with new biomes that are valuable and would fit with the update. However, now with the new timeline, I'm fully confident they will be able to pay attention to all of the small details that bring more life to an update, as well as fulfilling the design of major feature like the Deep Dark and Warden. Perhaps they might also get inspired along the way to add a new biome that actually contributes to the design of the update and adds more variety.

Redstone armor will have no usage after the skulk sensor comes out. And craftable chain mail armor would do... what? Remove a trophy item? 

 

Everything you said can be done in some other way or has no reasoning at all attributed to it. I'm perfectly fine with adding new armors, I have two different posts about it, but only if said armor is in the game for a specific unique reason.

That generation has some problems, though. The End Pillars would always be covered up in End Stone, meaning you can kill the Ender Dragon without destroying any of them. It would be perfect if they raise the End Pillars as well and make this the default generation. I wouldn't keep my hopes up, though.

I would never want the Nether roof to be phased out. The Nether wouldn't really feel like an underworld if it was just open to the sky. I definitely agree that its height should increase, perhaps allowing for vertically oriented biomes, though I wouldn't expect this too soon. However, it would never feel right if the Nether had no roof.
